meanings.definition: A lightweight jacket, typically in a solid color, often worn as part of a uniform or for a formal occasion.
meanings.sent1: She wore a navy blazer to the job interview.
meanings.sent2: The school requires students to wear a blazer as part of their uniform.
meanings.sent3: The blazer looked too big on the tiny puppy, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her blazer of confidence helped her ace the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The bright red blazer stood out in the sea of black suits.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that blazes a trail or marks a path.
meanings.sent1: The explorer was a true blazer, always leading the way through the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: The blazer of the group made sure everyone stayed on the right path.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel became an accidental blazer, leaving a trail of acorns behind.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a blazer in the foggy journey of life.
meanings.sent5: The blazer bird guided the lost travelers with its melodic song.

meanings.definition: A type of ship used for carrying cargo.
meanings.sent1: The blazer sailed across the ocean with valuable cargo on board.
meanings.sent2: The old blazer creaked as it transported goods from one port to another.
meanings.sent3: The blazer ship seemed to have a mind of its own, choosing its own routes.
meanings.sent4: The blazer navigated through rough waters with ease, a true master of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The blazer's hull was filled with treasures from distant lands.
